title: [ENH] ensure all `BaseObjects` are tested, split object from estimator tests
body:
Currently, objects (`BaseObject` descendants) that are not `BaseEstimator`s are not tested for `sklearn` compatibility, but they should be. The testing framework has all interface compliance tests needed for that, so could be adapted in-principle.

Example bug that was not detected due to this: https://github.com/alan-turing-institute/sktime/issues/3119

Affected objects:
* splitters, `BaseSplitter` descendants
* performance metrics, `BaseMetric` descendants
* rarely used objects present in the codebase like `BaseTask`

The key problem that needs to be addressed is that currently the test framework assumes inheritance from `BaseEstimator`, and therefore presence of `fit` and associated interface assumptions.

Changes that would need to be made:
* split `TestAllEstimators` into a part for objects and a part for estimators. Also relates to work on https://github.com/sktime/BaseObject where this splitting is currently ongoing. There should be a `TestAllObjects`, and, separately, `TestAllEstimators`.
* add base classes to the base class registry in `registry._base_classes`, including `BaseObject` as a base class that is not there yet
* optionally, add additional tests that are specific to the more specific base classes like `BaseSplitter`, `BaseMetric`. Existing tests should be moved into the test class
* ensure the newly tested classes are interface compliant, by fixing any bugs similar to #3119 that the upgraded testing framework discovers
